page_analysis.text_content:
Height & grade

Height allowances enable a variety of architectural styles while preserving the residential scale of our neighborhoods as well as the privacy and natural light available to each lot.

Code sections
Page 46
18.12.040 (a) Table 2
Page 47
18.04.030 (64) (b)

Height

Structure	Max. height to roof peak

Main dwelling on a standard lot with a roof slope <12:12	30'

Main dwelling on a standard lot with a roof slope ≥12:12	33'

Main dwelling on a substandard or flag lot	17'

Accessory structure in rear or side yard	12'

2nd-dwelling units	17'

Fig 42 Comparison of roof slopes

Height measured to top of roof material

33'
30'

12 : 14
12 : 12
12 : 10
12 : 6
12 : 3

Height limit = 33'
Height limit = 30'

Fig 43 Determing slope of roof

12" run
6" rise

Roof slope is the vertical rise in inches for every horizontal distance of twelve inches (called the "run"). It is expressed as rise:run or, in this example 6:12.

Note: On a drawing this slope might also be represented as:
6 12 or 1 2

visual_elements.description: Table listing structure types and their maximum height to roof peak. Structures include main dwelling on standard lot with roof slope <12:12 (30'), main dwelling on standard lot with roof slope ≥12:12 (33'), main dwelling on substandard or flag lot (17'), accessory structure in rear or side yard (12'), and 2nd-dwelling units (17').

Diagram labeled 'Fig 43 Determing slope of roof' showing a roof edge with a horizontal run of 12 inches and a vertical rise of 6 inches, illustrating how roof slope is measured as rise over run (6:12). Includes note on alternative slope representations (6/12 or 1/2).

Figure labeled 'Fig 42 Comparison of roof slopes' showing five stylized house roof shapes with different slopes: 12:14, 12:12, 12:10, 12:6, and 12:3. Above the roofs are height limits of 33' and 30', with a note that height is measured to the top of roof material.
Vertical sidebar on left side of page with text explaining height allowances and code section references (Page 46: 18.12.040 (a) Table 2, Page 47: 18.04.030 (64) (b)).

technical_specifications.parameter: Max. height to roof peak for main dwelling on a standard lot with roof slope <12:12
Max. height to roof peak for main dwelling on a standard lot with roof slope ≥12:12
Max. height to roof peak for main dwelling on a substandard or flag lot
Max. height to roof peak for accessory structure in rear or side yard
Max. height to roof peak for 2nd-dwelling units

subheadings: Height allowances enable a variety of architectural styles while preserving the residential scale of our neighborhoods as well as the privacy and natural light available to each lot.

additional_notes: No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and diagrams are clear and legible.
Page number 46 located at bottom left corner.
cross_references: Code sections referenced: Page 46 (18.12.040 (a) Table 2) and Page 47 (18.04.030 (64) (b))
